intro: Eriocaulon exiguum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are typically borne on short, upright stems. It is often found in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in environments with consistently moist soil. Eriocaulon exiguum is a valuable component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
